sub_title: Strategic Program Development Advisor / Program Manager Sahel at IDLO - International Development Law Organization
summary: Marco Lankhorst (PhD). I'm a lawyer and an economist with extensive field experience in various African countries, including Burkina Faso, Burundi, the Democratic Republic of Congo (North Kivu, South Kivu, and Ituri), Mali, Namibia, Niger and Rwanda, where I have been active as a scholar, consultant, and development practitioner. Thematically, my work centers on strengthening the rule of law (access to justice and legal empowerment, criminal justice systems, customary justice systems), company-community conflicts (business and human rights) and the land governance (land registration and dispute management mechanisms). I specialize in developing both a macro (policy maker) and a micro (beneficiary) perspective on the problems I work on, and to find solutions that are practical and meaningful at both levels. I combine this with extensive experience in designing and implementing large scale and tailored projects and programs.

projects.title: Certification Foncière à Makamba - Burundi
projects.description: This project is led by the Dutch NGO ZOA (Budget: EUR 3.9 mio). Since 2007 a number of pilot projects have been started in Burundi to test various approaches to community-based land certification. These pilots leave a number of important issues unaddressed, including: (1) how registries can be kept up to date, (2) how to avoid erosion of women’s interests in land, and (3) how to deal with tensions between ex-refugees and incumbents in the process of certification. This project, in which The Hague Institute acts as academic back-stopper and is responsible the impact study, is meant to answer these questions and prepare the ground for a national certification program.

projects.title: Reconciliation and Human Security - Mali
projects.description: The international branch of the Dutch association of municipalities, VNG-International, and its Malian counterpart, have obtained funding from the Dutch embassy in Mali and other donors to implement a 3 year project intended to foster reconciliation and human security in Mali. At present, a peace accord is being negotiated nationally between the government and a number of rebel movements. The ideas that inspire this project are that peace will be more sustainable if it is supported and informed by a process of dialogue and reconciliation between opposing communities at local (micro) level and that, for peace to hold, human security in northern Mali needs to improve. The Hague Institute acts as an academic back-stopper for the consortium and is responsible for conducting a baseline study.

projects.title: Good Governance and Rule of Law in Fragile States
projects.description: In partnership with The Hague Academy for Local Governance, The Hague Institute is developing and testing a 6-week training program on the topic of good local governance and rule of law in fragile states, targeting development practitioners, officials from Southern governments, and students. After war or mass conflict, it is essential to quickly bring about stability. Most such efforts will center on strengthening capacities of government institutions at central level. But in many post conflict countries, particularly in rural areas, central government institutions remain distant and detached from the population. In such a situation, the state is to a large extent associated with and represented by local governments. Local governments are, thus, in a unique position to contribute to restoring the state’s legitimacy and allowing peace to take root. The training program aims to enable participants to address the problems with good local governance and rule of law in fragile states. It deals with these problems in terms of three dimensions: reconstituting legitimacy, re-establishing security, and rebuilding effectiveness.

projects.title: Guardians of Justice Project - Mali and Uganda
projects.description: Governments, donors, and civil society organizations need good information in their efforts to strengthen the rule of law. This project, implemented in partnership with HiiL, is about developing and testing empirical methods for appraising the rule of law context in a state, tracking rule of law context evolutions, and assessing the effectiveness of interventions aimed at strengthening the rule of law. The methodology was developed in a past phase. The current phase is about testing the methodology in Mali (starting January 2014).

projects.title: Restoring the Contract - Burundi and DRC
projects.description: This project (4 years, 4,5 mio euros) is led by a consortium of Dutch NGOs (Cordaid, VNG-International, and CILC). It relies on an innovative performance-based financing approach to improve human security in Burundi and South Kivu (DRC) by giving local communities a say in the management of justice and security matters. The Hague Institute acts as an academic back-stopper for the consortium and is responsible for conducting an impact study that focuses on the effects in terms of the incidence of violence, crime, and conflict.

projects.title: Development of overarching monitoring framework for the 2012 - 2015 Reconstruction Programme
projects.description: Developed a framework that provided a basis for reporting by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands to others, including Parliament. Reporting was on the overall results of 29 projects selected under the 2012-2015 reconstruction programme of the Ministry. The framework arranges the outcomes of each of these 29 projects under the sub-goals of the Security and Rule of Lawe Policy of the Ministry. Per sub-goal 3 generic outcomes were developed in the course of the assignment, as well as a start of parts of an overall Theory of Change and output areas (as specific areas of intervention). Project outcomes were placed under generic outcomes.

profile_positions.description: In this position, I manage two portfolios: as Program Manager Sahel, I am responsible for the start-up and implementation of IDLO's Sahel program in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger. In addition, as Strategic Program Development Advisor I lead c.q. contribute to the organization's main initiatives for program development and expansion in the Sahel, MENA and Horn of Africa and to quality control of project proposals developed by IDLO country offices and the assessment of project proposals by implementing partners. In addition, I act as IDLO representative on the Management Committee of the Dutch Knowledge Platform for Security and Rule of Law.

profile_positions.description: As IDLO's Head of Research, I was responsible for research unit, which manages the institutional lessons learned program and assures quality control of all knowledge products produced within the organization. In addition, I was responsible for a strategic organizational initiative to strengthen IDLO's capacity to monitor outcome level results and to aggregate country and project-level results under the outcomes and objectives of IDLO’s strategic plan and acted as IDLO's member on the management committee of the Dutch Knowledge Platform for Security and Rule of Law.
profile_positions.title: Head of Research

profile_positions.description: IDLO is an intergovernmental organization that promotes justice, peace and development by providing legal expertise to governments, multilateral and civil society organizations. It seeks to enhance human rights, economic growth and good governance through technical assistance on judicial and legal reform, capacity-building and legal empowerment programs and projects. As senior research and learning officer, I was responsible for the coordination of the work of the research unit, which is part of the department of research and learning. In addition to initiating and supervising research that strengthens IDLO’s position as a thought leader on rule of law promotion, a key task of the unit and department is to ensure that lessons from research are translated into programming and that experiences gathered in programming inform our research.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research and Learning Officer

profile_positions.company: The Hague Institute for Global Justice
profile_positions.description: The Hague Institute for Global Justice engages in interdisciplinary policy-relevant research and convenes experts, practitioners and policymakers to facilitate knowledge sharing. Through this work the Institute aims to contribute to, and further strengthen, the global framework for preventing and resolving conflict and promoting international peace and justice. Its Rule of Law Program is based on the premise that the rule of law is crucial for creating sustainable peace in societies making the difficult transition from war or conflict. Without it, insecurity, corruption, impunity, and criminality undermine stability and democracy and threaten a return to violence and chaos. The program therefore seeks to improve the effectiveness of Rule of Law promotion in fragile states. My work as project leader/senior researcher entailed a combination of (field) research, advocacy, project management, and project development. In addition, I functioned as the Institute’s M&E focal point.
